ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ أَيُّوبَ الْصِدِّيق بَرَكَتُهُ الْمُقَدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا. آمين . ( ۲۰ : ۱ - ۲۹ )

Hymn.Arabic: أَجَابَ صُوفَرُ النَّعْمَانِيُّ وَقَالَ:
Hymn.English: 20:1 Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said:

Hymn.Arabic: لِذَلِكَ تُلْهِمُنِي خَوَاطِرِي ، وَمِنْ أَجْلِهَا مَا بِيَ مِنْ الاضْطِرَابِ
Hymn.English: 2 Therefore my anxious thoughts make me answer, Because of the turmoil within me.

Hymn.Arabic: لَقَدْ سَمِعْتُ تَوْبِيخًا يُعَيِّرْنِي. فَلَقَّنَنِي رُوحٌ مِنْ فِطْنَتِي.
Hymn.English: 3 I have heard the rebuke that reproaches me, And the spirit of my understanding causes me to answer.

Hymn.Arabic: أَعَلِمْتَ هَذَا مُنْذُ الدَّهْرِ ، مُنْذُ جُعِلَ الْبَشَرُ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ ،
Hymn.English: 4 Do you not know this of old, Since man was placed on earth,

Hymn.Arabic: أَنَّ طَرَبَ الْمُنَافِقِينَ قَرِيبُ الزَّوَالِ ، وَأَنَّ فَرَحَ الْكَافِرِ لَمْحَةٌ ؟
Hymn.English: 5 That the triumphing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the hypocrite is but for a moment?

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنَّهُ وَلَوْ بَلَغَ السَّمَاءَ ارْتِفَاعًا ، وَلَطَمَتْ هَامَتُهُ السَّحَابَ.
Hymn.English: 6 Though his haughtiness mounts up to the heavens, And his head reaches to the clouds,

Hymn.Arabic: يَهْلِكُ إِلَى الْأَبَدِ كَعَذِرَتِهِ. فَيَقُولُ الَّذِينَ يَرَوْنَهُ: أَيْنَ هُوَ؟
Hymn.English: 7 Yet he will perish forever like his own refuse; Those who have seen him will say, `Where is he?'

Hymn.Arabic: يَطِيرُ كَالْحُلْمِ فَلَا يُوجَدُ ، وَيَضْمَحِلُّ كَرُؤْيَا اللَّيْلِ
Hymn.English: 8 He will fly away like a dream, and not be found; Yes, he will be chased away like a vision of the night.

Hymn.Arabic: وَالْعَيْنُ الَّتِي لَمَحَتْهُ لَا تَعُودُ تَلْمَحُهُ ، وَلَا يَرَاهُ مَكَانُهُ مِنْ بَعْدُ.
Hymn.English: 9 The eye that saw him will see him no more, Nor will his place behold him anymore.

Hymn.Arabic: بَنُوهُ يُوفُونَ الْمَسَاكِينَ حَقَّهُمْ ، بَلْ كَفَّاهُ تَرُدَّانِ سَلْبَهُ.
Hymn.English: 10 His children will seek the favor of the poor, And his hands will restore his wealth.

Hymn.Arabic: رَذَائِلُ شَبَابِهِ تَمْلَأُ عِظَامَهُ ، وَمَعَهُ تَضْطَجِعُ فِي التُّرَابِ.
Hymn.English: 11 His bones are full of his youthful vigor, But it will lie down with him in the dust.

Hymn.Arabic: إِذْ حَلَا السُّوءُ بِفِيهِ ، وَخَبَّأَهُ تَحْتَ لِسَانِهِ.
Hymn.English: 12 Though evil is sweet in his mouth, And he hides it under his tongue,

Hymn.Arabic: وَادَّخَرَهُ وَلَمْ يُلْقِهِ ، بَلْ أَحْرَزَهُ ضِمْنَ حَنَكِهِ.
Hymn.English: 13 Though he spares it and does not forsake it, But still keeps it in his mouth,

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنَّ طَعَامَهُ هَذَا يَتَحَوَّلُ فِي أَمْعَائِهِ إِلَى مَرَارَةِ صِلٍّ فِي جَوْفِهِ.
Hymn.English: 14 Yet his food in his stomach turns sour; It becomes cobra venom within him.

Hymn.Arabic: قَدِ ابْتَلَعَ أَمْوَالًا إِلَّا أَنَّهُ يَقِيئُهَا , اللَّهُ يَسْتَخْرِجُهَا مِنْ جَوْفِهِ.
Hymn.English: 15 He swallows down riches And vomits them up again; God casts them out of his belly.

Hymn.Arabic: رَضَعَ سُمَّ الْأَصْلَالِ. فَقَتَلَهُ لِسَانُ الْأَفْعَى
Hymn.English: 16 He will suck the poison of cobras; The viper's tongue will slay him.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يَرَى مَجَارِيَ أَنْهَارٍ وَلَا سُيُولًا مِنْ عَسَلٍ وَزُبْدٍ.
Hymn.English: 17 He will not see the streams, The rivers flowing with honey and cream.

Hymn.Arabic: يَرُدُّ كَسْبَهُ وَلَا يَلْتَهِمُهُ. بَلْ يَرُدُّ نَظِيرَ سُحْتِهِ . وَلَا يَتَمَتَّعُ
Hymn.English: 18 He will restore that for which he labored, And will not swallow it down; From the proceeds of business He will get no enjoyment.

Hymn.Arabic: لِأَنَّهُ هَضَمَ الْمَسَاكِينَ ، وَخَذَلَهُمْ ، وَاغْتَصَبَ الْبُيُوتَ وَلَمْ يَبْنِهَا .
Hymn.English: 19 For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor, He has violently seized a house which he did not build.

Hymn.Arabic: وَإِذْ لَمْ يَعْرِفِ الْقَنَاعَةَ فِي جَوْفِهِ ، فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَنْجُو بِمَرَامِهِ.
Hymn.English: 20 Because he knows no quietness in his heart, He will not save anything he desires.

Hymn.Arabic: لَمْ يُبْقِ نَهَمَهُ عَلَى شَيْءٍ ، لِذَلِكَ نُعْمَاهُ لَا تَثْبُتُ
Hymn.English: 21 Nothing is left for him to eat; Therefore his well-being will not last.

Hymn.Arabic: فِي إِبَّانِ السَّعَةِ يُصِيبُهُ الضَّنْكُ. وَتَقَعُ عَلَيْهِ يَدُ كُلَّ بَلِيَّةٍ
Hymn.English: 22 In his self-sufficiency he will be in distress; Every hand of misery will come against him.

Hymn.Arabic: لِيَكُنْ لَهُ أَنْ يَمْلَأَ بَطْنَهُ ، لِيَصُبَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ نَارَ غَضَبِهِ ، وَلْيُمْطِرُهَا عَلَيْهِ طَعَامًا.
Hymn.English: 23 When he is about to fill his stomach, God will cast on him the fury of His wrath, And will rain it on him while he is eating.

Hymn.Arabic: إِنْ فَرَّ مِنْ آلَةِ الْحَدِيدِ فَلْتَخْتَرِمُهُ قَوْسُ النُّحَاسِ،
Hymn.English: 24 He will flee from the iron weapon; A bronze bow will pierce him through.

Hymn.Arabic: يَنْزِعُ فِيهَا فَيَنْفُذُ النُّصْلُ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ ، وَيَلْمَعُ مِنْ كَبِدِهِ وَتَخْشَاهُ الْأَهْوَالُ
Hymn.English: 25 It is drawn, and comes out of the body; Yes, the glittering point comes out of his gall. Terrors come upon him;

Hymn.Arabic: كُلُّ ظَلَامٍ مُدَّخَرٌ فِي كُنُوزِهِ. وَتَأْكُلُهُ نَارٌ لَمْ يُنْفَخُ فِيهَا. وَتُتْلِفُ مَا بَقِيَ فِي خِبَائِهِ.
Hymn.English: 26 Total darkness is reserved for his treasures. An unfanned fire will consume him; It shall go ill with him who is left in his tent.

Hymn.Arabic: تَكْشِفُ السَّمَاوَاتُ عَنْ إِثْمِهِ ، وَالْأَرْضُ تَقُومُ عَلَيْهِ
Hymn.English: 27 The heavens will reveal his iniquity, And the earth will rise up against him.

Hymn.Arabic: تُسْلَبُ غِلَالُ بَيْتِهِ. وَتُهَالُ فِي يَوْمٍ غَضَبِ اللَّهِ.
Hymn.English: 28 The increase of his house will depart, And his goods will flow away in the day of His wrath.

Hymn.Arabic: ذَلِكَ حَظُ الرَّجُلِ الْمُنَافِقِ مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ ، وَمِيرَاثُهُ بِأَمْرِ الْقَدِيرِ.
Hymn.English: 29 This is the portion from God for a wicked man, The heritage appointed to him by God
